definition: to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
Hatoyama Yukio (1947-), Japanese Democratic Party politician, prime minister 2009-2010
KOIZUMI Jun'ichirō (1942-), Japanese LDP politician, prime minister 2001-2006
Ishihara Jintarō (1932-), Japanese author and politician, governor of Tokyo since 1999
FUKUDA Yasuo (1936-), Japanese LDP politician, prime minister 2007-2008
MORI Yoshirō (1937-), Japanese rugby player and politician, prime minister 2000-2001, famous for numerous gaffes
a guild/(in olden times) an association such as a political party, religious group or trade guild/the Japanese word for company
Asō (name)/ASŌ Tarō (1940-), Japanese entrepreneur and LDP politician, prime minister 2008-2009
Yasukuni Shrine, Shinto shrine in Tokyo to Japanese war dead, controversial as burial ground of several Class A war criminals
foreign ministry (e.g. of Japan or Korea)
KOMURA Masahiko (1942-), Japanese politician, foreign minister from 1998, minister of defense from 2007
